summary.incident:
The referee is firm and issues Johan Manzambi
(Freiburg) a deserved yellow card.

Jakub Kaminski (1. FC Koln) took a great
touch to control a beautiful cross inside
the box and thundered the ball into the
roof of the net. What a strike!

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Eric Martel (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh
and Tobias Reichel didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

Half-time substitution. Timo Hubers (1.
FC Koln) will not participate anymore and
Joel Schmied is coming on.

There will be a change on the pitch for
the second half. Julian Schuster probably
wasn't satisfied with the performance of
Eren Dinkci (Freiburg). He is replaced by
Merlin Rohl.

It's a goal! Jan Thielmann sends a long
raking pass onto the head of Marius Bulter
(1. FC Koln), who makes no mistake from
close in and sends the ball into the bottom
right corner. 2:0.

Joel Schmied (1. FC Koln) violates the laws
of the game and is shown a deserved yellow
card by the referee.

Jan Thielmann (1. FC Koln) collects a pass
and without hesitation fires an unstoppable
shot inside the right post.

Lukas Kwasniok has decided to substitute
Denis Huseinbasic and he is replaced by
Tom Krauss (1. FC Koln).

Lukas Kwasniok has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Said El Mala (1. FC Koln)
replacing Jan Thielmann.

Lukas Kwasniok prepares a substitution.
Kristoffer Lund is replaced by Jusuf Gazibegovic
(1. FC Koln).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Anthony Jung (Freiburg)
will replace Yuito Suzuki.

The referee signals a substitution. Nicolas
Hofler (Freiburg) is brought on as a substitute
for Vincenzo Grifo.

Lukas Kwasniok has decided to make a change.
Ragnar Ache (1. FC Koln) replaces Marius
Bulter.

Goal! Said El Mala (1. FC Koln) fires the
rebound into the top left corner after the
ball breaks to him in the box. The score
is 4:0.

Goal! Christian Gunter sent in a fine cross
from the corner kick. The perfect pass found
Maximilian Eggestein (Freiburg) and his
precise header from around the penalty spot
went into the bottom left corner. 4:1.

Lukas Kubler goes off the pitch and Philipp
Treu (Freiburg) comes on.

Here is a change. Lucas Holer is going off
and Julian Schuster gives the last tactical
orders to Junior Adamu (Freiburg).

Yan Couto sends a precise lofted cross into
the box. Serhou Guirassy (Dortmund) latches
on to it and finishes with a quick shot
into the top of the net. The goalkeeper
had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.

GOAL - 2:0! Maximilian Beier found Serhou
Guirassy (Dortmund) inside the box, he spotted
goalkeeper Frederik Ronnow off his line
and chipped the ball into the net. What
a cheeky lob!

Substitution. Tim Skarke (Union Berlin)
has come on for Christopher Trimmel.

Steffen Baumgart has decided to substitute
Alex Kral and he is replaced by Woo-Yeong
Jeong (Union Berlin).

Steffen Baumgart decides to make a substitution.
Ilyas Ansah will be replaced by Oliver Burke
(Union Berlin).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Derrick Kohn (Union Berlin)
comes onto the pitch for Robert Skov.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Jobe Bellingham walks off the pitch
to be replaced by Felix Nmecha (Dortmund).

Today's match ends for Aaron Anselmino who
will be replaced by Julian Ryerson (Dortmund).

Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Carney Chukwuemeka (Dortmund)
replacing Maximilian Beier.

Goal! Felix Nmecha (Dortmund) picks up the
ball from a rebound and from the edge of
the box he unleashes a shot inside the right
post. It's 3:0.

Substitution. Janik Haberer did his best
and is replaced by Aljoscha Kemlein (Union
Berlin).

A substitution has been made. Marcel Sabitzer
is replaced by Pascal Gross (Dortmund).

Here is a change. Serhou Guirassy is going
off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical
orders to Karim Adeyemi (Dortmund).

Goal! Lovro Majer passes the ball to Aaron
Zehnter (Wolfsburg) and he fires in a shot
from the edge of the box which is deflected.
Robin Zentner couldn't do anything about
it. 1:0.

Danny da Costa (Mainz) is shown a yellow
card by the referee.

Robin Zentner (Mainz) kept talking out of
turn to the referee until Soren Storks lost
patience and pulled out a yellow card.

The teams are back out for the second half
and here is a change on the pitch. Bo Henriksen
gives a chance to Andreas Hanche-Olsen and
Stefan Bell (Mainz) is off.

Half-time substitution. Andreas Skov Olsen
(Wolfsburg) will not participate anymore
and Vaclav Cerny is coming on.

Andreas Hanche-Olsen (Mainz) can't expect
anything else than a yellow card for his
hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Soren Storks
didn't think twice about pulling it out
of his pocket.

Soren Storks shows a yellow card to Patrick
Wimmer (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

Substitution. Armindo Sieb (Mainz) in, Nelson
Weiper out.

Bo Henriksen has decided to substitute Phillipp
Mwene and he is replaced by Nikolas Veratschnig
(Mainz).

The manager makes a subsitution with Mohamed
Amoura (Wolfsburg) coming on for Dzenan
Pejcinovic.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Mattias Svanberg (Wolfsburg)
is coming onto the pitch as Lovro Majer
cannot continue after picking up an injury.

It's time for a substitution. Ben Bobzien
(Mainz) comes on in place of Arnaud Nordin.

Anthony Caci (Mainz) is shown a yellow card
after a horrible tackle.

Goal! Nadiem Amiri (Mainz) takes just a
short run up and buries the penalty inside
the left post.

Here is a change. Aaron Zehnter is going
off and Paul Simonis gives the last tactical
orders to Joakim Maehle (Wolfsburg).

It will be a substitution. Jonas Wind (Wolfsburg)
is ready to enter the pitch as Vini Souza
walks off.

Mattias Svanberg (Wolfsburg) picked up a
yellow card from referee.

Mattias Svanberg (Wolfsburg) should have
been more careful. He commits a bad foul,
receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!

Today's referee Soren Storks rightly decides
to book Armindo Sieb (Mainz) for his harsh
tackle.

Goal! Harry Kane picks out Serge Gnabry
(Bayern Munich) with a perfect cross, and
he has no problem to nod the ball into an
empty net. It's 0:1.

Florian Exner shows a yellow card to Jeffrey
Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.

Marius Wolf is substituted due to injury.
Sandro Wagner gives a chance to Elvis Rexhbecaj
(Augsburg).

Luis Diaz (Bayern Munich) received a delightful
pass inside the box before slotting the
ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant
finish!

Michael Olise (Bayern Munich) makes a great
solo run and pulls the trigger from inside
the box, beating Finn Dahmen with a strike
into the bottom right corner. He makes it
0:3.

Kristijan Jakic (Augsburg) receives a killer
pass, finds himself one-on-one with the
goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into
the back of the net.

The referee shows a yellow card to Konrad
Laimer (Bayern Munich). No wonder. A clear
yellow for bad language.

Michael Olise (Bayern Munich) receives a
yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Sandro Wagner has decided to make a change.
Phillip Tietz (Augsburg) replaces Elias
Saad.

Dimitrios Giannoulis just cannot continue
due to injury and has to be substituted.
Anton Kade (Augsburg) replaces him.

Vincent Kompany decides to make a substitution.
Leon Goretzka will be replaced by Aleksandar
Pavlovic (Bayern Munich).

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Konrad Laimer as he
is replaced by Sacha Boey (Bayern Munich).

Goal! Great play by Kristijan Jakic releases
Mert Komur (Augsburg) in space on the edge
of the box. He spots the keeper off his
line and coolly puts the ball into bottom
right corner. 2:3.

Keven Schlotterbeck (Augsburg) is cautioned
by the referee for a foul that he committed
a little earlier.

Substitution. Raphael Guerreiro (Bayern
Munich) replaces Serge Gnabry.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Noahkai Banks (Augsburg)
comes onto the pitch for Han-Noah Massengo.

Luis Diaz (Bayern Munich) has tested the
patience of referee Florian Exner and goes
into the book for a previous late challenge.

Sacha Boey (Bayern Munich) makes a really
bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved
when the referee only shows him a yellow
card.

Florian Exner shows a yellow card to Cedric
Zesiger (Augsburg) for his unsportsmanlike
behavior after the match has ended.

Ritsu Doan (Eintracht Frankfurt) scores
an absolute screamer from outside the penalty
area, with the ball flying into the top
left corner!

Ritsu Doan (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives
a delightful pass inside the box and smashes
a precise shot inside the right post. What
a lovely finish!

Booking. Fares Chaibi (Eintracht Frankfurt)
receives a caution from the referee.

Can Yilmaz Uzun (Eintracht Frankfurt) collects
a sweet pass and fires a shot inside the
right post. What a brilliant shot!

Umut Tohumcu (Hoffenheim) has tested the
patience of referee Timo Gerach and goes
into the book for a previous late challenge.

Substitution. Grischa Promel (Hoffenheim)
has come on for Umut Tohumcu.

Christian Ilzer has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Muhammed Damar (Hoffenheim)
replacing Andrej Kramaric.

It will be a substitution. Ansgar Knauff
(Eintracht Frankfurt) is ready to enter
the pitch as Jean-Matteo Bahoya walks off.

We are about to witness a substitution.
Nathaniel Brown (Eintracht Frankfurt) is
replacing Can Yilmaz Uzun.

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Robin Hranac as he
is replaced by Albian Hajdari (Hoffenheim).

Christian Ilzer prepares a substitution.
Fisnik Asllani is replaced by Max Moerstedt
(Hoffenheim).

A substitution has been made. Ritsu Doan
goes off and Buta (Eintracht Frankfurt)
comes on.

Rasmus Kristensen (Eintracht Frankfurt)
is cautioned by the referee.

The substitution has been made. Oscar Hojlund
(Eintracht Frankfurt) has replaced Rasmus
Kristensen.
Caution goes to Grischa Promel (Hoffenheim).

Dino Toppmoller has decided to make a change.
Michy Batshuayi (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces
Elye Wahi.
Buta (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked.

Substitution. Bernardo leaves the pitch
and is replaced by Alexander Prass (Hoffenheim).

What a beautiful moment! Grischa Promel
(Hoffenheim) got to the ball and unleashed
a strong shot from distance. It turned out
to be a good decision as his effort found
its way inside the left post. Michael Zetterer
just shakes his head in disbelief. The score
changes to 1:3.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Jonas Fohrenbach (Heidenheim) was quite
harsh and Frank Willenborg didn't hesitate
to show him a yellow card.

Ezechiel Banzuzi (RB Leipzig) goes into
the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow
card is necessary in this case.

Christoph Baumgartner (RB Leipzig) receives
a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one
with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the
ball into the back of the net.

Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to
Mikkel Kaufmann Sorensen (Heidenheim) for
his blatant foul.

The game is interrupted. Marnon Busch (Heidenheim)
is given a yellow card. He has to be more
careful now.

Frank Schmidt prepares a substitution. Mikkel
Kaufmann Sorensen is replaced by Budu Zivzivadze
(Heidenheim).

The manager makes a subsitution with Julian
Niehues (Heidenheim) coming on for Niklas
Dorsch.

Substitution. Arijon Ibrahimovic leaves
the pitch and is replaced by Sirlord Conteh
(Heidenheim).

Luca Kerber (Heidenheim) picked up a yellow
card from referee.

David Raum (RB Leipzig) picks up a yellow
card.

Sirlord Conteh (Heidenheim) has to be very
careful for the rest of the match after
receiving a yellow card from the referee
for a bad tackle on an opponent.

A substitution has been made. Ezechiel Banzuzi
goes off and Nicolas Seiwald (RB Leipzig)
comes on.

Ole Werner has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Yan Diomande (RB Leipzig) replacing
Johan Bakayoko.

Frank Schmidt has decided to substitute
Luca Kerber and he is replaced by Adrian
Beck (Heidenheim).

Here comes a substitution. Mathias Honsak
is given a rest as he is replaced by Omar
Haktab Traore (Heidenheim).

GOAL! Romulo Cardoso (RB Leipzig) finishes
off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel
goal. Ridle Baku provided the assist with
a brilliant pass. 2:0.

Here is a change. Romulo Cardoso is going
off and Ole Werner gives the last tactical
orders to Lois Openda (RB Leipzig).

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Christoph Baumgartner
as he is replaced by Assan Ouedraogo (RB
Leipzig).

Substitution. Kosta Nedeljkovic (RB Leipzig)
in, Ridle Baku out.

Deniz Undav (VfB Stuttgart) is substituted
due to injury. Sebastian Hoeness gives a
chance to Chris Fuhrich.

Maximilian Mittelstadt (VfB Stuttgart) takes
his opponent down and receives a yellow
card from the referee.

Jamie Leweling (VfB Stuttgart) is cautioned
by the referee for a foul that he committed
a little earlier.

Chema Andres (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Atakan Karazor.

Sebastian Hoeness has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Lazar Jovanovic (VfB Stuttgart)
replacing Chris Fuhrich.

Sebastian Hoeness has decided to make a
change. Nikolas Nartey (VfB Stuttgart) replaces
Maximilian Mittelstadt.

Substitution. Lorenz Assignon (VfB Stuttgart)
replaces Tiago Tomas.

Substitution. Shuto Machino leaves the pitch
and is replaced by Jens Castrop (B. Monchengladbach).

Joe Scally (B. Monchengladbach) shouldn't
be surprised it's a yellow from the ref,
who cooled the situation down well.

Chema Andres (VfB Stuttgart) scores from
quite a difficult position as he leaps high
to connect with a cross and powers his header
low inside the right post. Excellent finish.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Fabio Cristian Chiarodia
(B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch
for Kevin Stoger.

Here is a change. Rocco Reitz is going off
and Gerardo Seoane gives the last tactical
orders to Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach).

Lukas Ullrich will be replaced by Grant-Leon
Ranos (B. Monchengladbach).

Gerardo Seoane prepares a substitution.
Joe Scally is replaced by Luca Netz (B.
Monchengladbach).

Goal! Nathan Tella displays great vision
and sends a pass to Patrik Schick (Bayer
Leverkusen), who shows brilliant composure
inside the box to bury the ball from close
range in the back of the net. The score
is 0:1.

Spectacular goal! Malik Tillman (Bayer Leverkusen)
brilliantly darts into the box to latch
on to a cross and fires the ball in off
the bottom of the left post, leaving the
goalkeeper stunned!

Yellow card. Senne Lynen (Werder Bremen)
goes into the book for a bad tackle on his
opponent.

GOAL! That’s a perfect strike from the spot
by Romano Schmid (Werder Bremen) high into
the middle of the goal, giving goalkeeper
Mark Flekken no chance!

The referee shows the yellow card to Niklas
Stark (Werder Bremen).

Christian Michel Kofane (Bayer Leverkusen)
makes it easy for the referee to show him
a yellow card.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Exequiel Palacios (Bayer
Leverkusen) will replace Aleix Garcia.

Erik ten Hag has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Claudio Echeverri (Bayer Leverkusen)
replacing Malik Tillman.

Robin Braun blows his whistle and Niklas
Stark (Werder Bremen) is shown a second
yellow card for his foul. His manager will
not be pleased. He has lot of time to think
about it as he walks off.

GOAL! Patrik Schick (Bayer Leverkusen) takes
a real chance, but his penalty strike right
into the middle of the net fools Mio Backhaus
in goal.

Here comes a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt
(Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute
for Patrice Covic.

Here is a change. Justin Njinmah is going
off and Horst Steffen gives the last tactical
orders to Skelly Alvero (Werder Bremen).

Robin Braun shows a yellow card to Nathan
Tella (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant
foul.

It is time for a substitution. Isaac Schmidt
(Werder Bremen) is on for Samuel Mbangula.

Substitution. Keke Topp (Werder Bremen)
in, Marco Grull out.

The referee signals a substitution. Loic
Bade (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as
a substitute for Axel Tape.

Erik ten Hag has decided to substitute Christian
Michel Kofane and he is replaced by Ernest
Poku (Bayer Leverkusen).

Goal! Some very poor defending from the
opponent allows Isaac Schmidt (Werder Bremen)
the chance to get to the edge of the box
and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish.
It's 2:3.

Jarell Quansah (Bayer Leverkusen) receives
a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

The substitution has been made. Ibrahim
Maza (Bayer Leverkusen) has replaced Nathan
Tella.

Isaac Schmidt (Werder Bremen) has to be
very careful for the rest of the match after
receiving a yellow card from the referee
for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Goal! The rebound fell to Karim Coulibaly
(Werder Bremen) and he fired home from close
range. The score is 3:3.

Adam Dzwigala (St. Pauli) has to be very
careful for the rest of the match after
receiving a yellow card from the referee
for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Goal! Mathias Pereira Lage tees up Adam
Dzwigala (St. Pauli) inside the box, and
he keeps his cool to find the top right
corner. 0:1.

Giorgi Gocholeishvili (Hamburger) is booked
for saying more than Christian Dingert was
willing to tolerate.

Danel Sinani (St. Pauli) receives a yellow
card from the referee, but it seems like
a very harsh decision.

The referee looks satisfied after his VAR
review and duly disallows the goal for offside.
The Hamburger SV players look gutted.

Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to
Arkadiusz Pyrka (St. Pauli), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

A substitution has been made. Emir Sahiti
goes off and Yussuf Poulsen (Hamburger)
comes on.

Merlin Polzin has decided to make a change.
Jean-Luc Dompe (Hamburger) replaces Alexander
Rossing-Lelesiit.

The manager makes a subsitution with Manolis
Saliakas (St. Pauli) coming on for Arkadiusz
Pyrka.

Joel Fujita passes to Andreas Hountondji
(St. Pauli), who gets one-on-one with the
keeper. His dummy grounds the keeper and
he has a simple task lifting the ball over
him into the net.

Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to
Yussuf Poulsen (Hamburger) for his blatant
foul.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Martijn Kaars (St. Pauli)
is coming onto the pitch as Andreas Hountondji
cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Merlin Polzin prepares a substitution. Daniel
Elfadli is replaced by Rayan Philippe (Hamburger).

Here comes a substitution. Nicolas Capaldo
is given a rest as he is replaced by Otto
Stange (Hamburger).

Giorgi Gocholeishvili (Hamburger) should
have been more careful. He commits a bad
foul, receives his second yellow card and
is sent-off!

Substitution. William Mikelbrencis (Hamburger)
in, Ransford Konigsdorffer out.

Here is a change. Mathias Pereira Lage is
going off and Alexander Blessin gives the
last tactical orders to Connor Metcalfe
(St. Pauli).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Adam Dzwigala trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Lars Ritzka
(St. Pauli).

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Rocco Reitz (B. Monchengladbach) was
quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't
hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Nicolas Capaldo (Hamburger) violates the
laws of the game and is shown a deserved
yellow card by the referee.

Substitution. Kevin Stoger is replaced by
Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach).

Merlin Polzin has decided to make a change.
Rayan Philippe (Hamburger) replaces Emir
Sahiti.

Ransford Konigsdorffer comes off the pitch
to be replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (Hamburger).

Here is a change. Alexander Rossing-Lelesiit
is going off and Merlin Polzin gives the
last tactical orders to Jean-Luc Dompe (Hamburger).

The substitution is prepared. Kevin Diks
(B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as
a substitute, replacing Fabio Cristian Chiarodia.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Lukas Ullrich walks off the pitch to
be replaced by Luca Netz (B. Monchengladbach).

Gerardo Seoane has decided to substitute
Haris Tabakovic and he is replaced by Shuto
Machino (B. Monchengladbach).

Substitution. Jens Castrop (B. Monchengladbach)
receives a signal from the referee and is
now allowed to enter the pitch as Philipp
Sander walks off.

Joe Scally (B. Monchengladbach) has tested
the patience of referee Sascha Stegemann
and goes into the book for a previous late
challenge.

Merlin Polzin has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Jonas Meffert (Hamburger) replacing
Nicolas Capaldo.

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Giorgi Gocholeishvili
as he is replaced by William Mikelbrencis
(Hamburger).

Bo Henriksen prepares a substitution. Benedict
Hollerbach is replaced by Nelson Weiper
(Mainz).

Kristoffer Lund (1. FC Koln) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler
had an easy-decision to make.

Red card! Paul Nebel (Mainz) simply can't
believe his eyes. The referee makes the
call and sends him off.

Bo Henriksen (Mainz) gets a yellow card,
off the field.

Andreas Hanche-Olsen comes off the pitch
to be replaced by Stefan Bell (Mainz).

Here is a change. Nadiem Amiri is going
off and Bo Henriksen gives the last tactical
orders to Lennard Maloney (Mainz).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Anthony Caci trots off the
pitch and is replaced by Silvan Widmer (Mainz).

The referee signals a substitution. Cenk
Ozkacar (1. FC Koln) is brought on as a
substitute for Jan Thielmann.

Lukas Kwasniok has decided to make a change.
Ragnar Ache (1. FC Koln) replaces Kristoffer
Lund.

Substitution. Said El Mala (1. FC Koln)
receives a signal from the referee and is
now allowed to enter the pitch as Tom Krauss
walks off.

Substitution. Sebastian Sebulonsen did his
best and is replaced by Luca Waldschmidt
(1. FC Koln).

Lukas Kwasniok has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Florian Kainz (1. FC Koln)
replacing Isak Johannesson.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Joel Schmied (1. FC Koln) was quite harsh
and Tobias Stieler didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

Goal! Luca Waldschmidt swings the ball deep
into the box and finds Marius Bulter (1.
FC Koln) unmarked, and his close-range header
flies past the keeper into the left side
of the goal. 0:1.

Substitution. Dominik Kohr will be replaced
by Armindo Sieb (Mainz).

The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate
this behaviour. Adam Dzwigala (St. Pauli)
is given a yellow card.

Matthias Jollenbeck shows a yellow card
to Ramy Bensebaini (Dortmund) for his blatant
foul.

Goal! Marcel Sabitzer plays a hopeful cross
into a crowded box. Serhou Guirassy (Dortmund)
times his jump perfectly and sends a header
inside the right post from close in. 0:1.

Eric Smith (St. Pauli) is booked after bringing
down an opponent. Matthias Jollenbeck had
an easy-decision to make.

Serhou Guirassy (Dortmund) fails to beat
the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with
a shot inside the left post. Nikola Vasilj
anticipates his intention perfectly, though,
and leaps to stop his effort.

Half-time substitution. Karim Adeyemi (Dortmund)
is replaced by Julian Brandt.

Half-time substitution. Jobe Bellingham
(Dortmund) will not participate anymore
and Felix Nmecha is coming on.

It's in! Andreas Hountondji (St. Pauli)
finds space in the box and from close range
powers an unstoppable header into the bottom
left corner after a cheeky lofted pass from
Danel Sinani. 1:1.

The referee shows a yellow card to Yan Couto
(Dortmund). No wonder. A clear yellow for
bad language.

Stunning strike! Waldemar Anton (Dortmund)
latches on to a precise through ball from
Felix Nmecha before unleashing an unstoppable
shot into the bottom right corner from the
edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score
is now 1:2.

A substitution has been made. Andreas Hountondji
goes off and Abdoulie Ceesay (St. Pauli)
comes on.

Goal! Pascal Gross tees up Julian Brandt
(Dortmund) on the edge of the box and he
fires the ball into the left side of the
goal. 1:3.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Arkadiusz Pyrka leaves the
pitch and Manolis Saliakas (St. Pauli) comes
on.

Alexander Blessin decides to make a substitution.
Adam Dzwigala will be replaced by Connor
Metcalfe (St. Pauli).

That will be the end of the match for Filippo
Mane (Dortmund), who is shown a red card!

Goal! Danel Sinani (St. Pauli) puts the
ball into the right side of the goal past
the outstretched arm of Gregor Kobel.

Here is a change. Pascal Gross is going
off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical
orders to Salih Ozcan (Dortmund).

Here comes a substitution. James Sands is
given a rest as he is replaced by Oladapo
Afolayan (St. Pauli).

Goal! Eric Smith (St. Pauli) is teed up
on the edge of the box by Manolis Saliakas,
and his howitzer of a shot into the bottom
left corner gives the keeper no chance.
3:3.

Marcel Sabitzer (Dortmund) has tested the
patience of referee Matthias Jollenbeck
and goes into the book for a previous late
challenge.

Perfectly taken free kick! Alejandro Grimaldo
sends the ball in, Jarell Quansah (Bayer
Leverkusen) manages to jump highest near
the penalty spot and plants a cracking header
inside the right post. It's 1:0.

GOAL! Superb work from Bazoumana Toure,
who plays a vital role in the build-up.
He squares it to Fisnik Asllani (Hoffenheim),
who beats Mark Flekken with a brilliant
shot into the top left corner. 1:1.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) was quite
harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate
to show him a yellow card.

It must be a yellow card. It is. Koki Machida
(Hoffenheim) receives the caution after
an awful tackle.

Koki Machida (Hoffenheim) just cannot continue
due to injury and has to be substituted.
Arthur Chaves replaces him.

Leon Avdullahu (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow
card from the referee, but it seems like
a very harsh decision.

Erik ten Hag makes a switch. Ernest Poku
is coming on in place of Arthur (Bayer Leverkusen)
at the start of the second period.

Half-time substitution. Wouter Burger (Hoffenheim)
is replaced by Umut Tohumcu.

What a beautiful moment! Tim Lemperle (Hoffenheim)
got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot
from distance. It turned out to be a good
decision as his effort found its way into
the bottom left corner. Mark Flekken just
shakes his head in disbelief. The score
changes to 1:2.

The substitution is prepared. Kevin Akpoguma
(Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Robin Hranac.

Christian Ilzer decides to make a substitution.
Tim Lemperle will be replaced by Alexander
Prass (Hoffenheim).

Umut Tohumcu (Hoffenheim) is arguing with
the referee and is given a caution.

Erik ten Hag has decided to make a change.
Claudio Echeverri (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces
Ibrahim Maza.

It's time for a substitution. Christian
Michel Kofane (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on
in place of Nathan Tella.

Christian Ilzer is forced to make a change.
Vladimir Coufal (Hoffenheim) is unable to
continue due to injury, Grischa Promel comes
on.

Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Rasmus
Kristensen (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his
blatant foul.

Hugo Larsson slides a pass towards Can Yilmaz
Uzun (Eintracht Frankfurt) who unleashes
a fabulous shot from long range. The ball
goes behind the surprised goalkeeper and
into the top left corner. The score is now
1:0.

Goal! A nice lofted pass into the box by
Can Yilmaz Uzun is pounced on by Jean-Matteo
Bahoya (Eintracht Frankfurt). His close-range
strike flashes past Mio Backhaus and into
the bottom left corner. 2:0.

Yellow card. Julian Malatini (Werder Bremen)
goes into the book for a bad tackle on his
opponent.

Goal Jean-Matteo Bahoya (Eintracht Frankfurt)!
Jean-Matteo Bahoya (Eintracht Frankfurt)
was put through by Can Yilmaz Uzun and he
showed brilliant composure inside the box
to fire into the right side of the net.
3:0.

Justin Njinmah (Werder Bremen) finishes
his beautiful individual effort with a superb
strike from inside the box. Michael Zetterer
is just a bystander as the ball flies into
the left side of the goal. The score is
3:1.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Niklas Stark (Werder Bremen) was quite
harsh and Harm Osmers didn't hesitate to
show him a yellow card.

The referee cannot ignore such behaviour.
Justin Njinmah (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow
card and needs to watch himself for the
rest of the game.

We are about to witness a subsitution. Patrice
Covic (Werder Bremen) for Samuel Mbangula.

Dino Toppmoller has decided to substitute
Jean-Matteo Bahoya and he is replaced by
Ansgar Knauff (Eintracht Frankfurt).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Jonathan Burkardt trots
off the pitch and is replaced by Elye Wahi
(Eintracht Frankfurt).

Goal! Fares Chaibi provides Ansgar Knauff
(Eintracht Frankfurt) with a nice pass inside
the box. It allows him to finish with a
precise effort into the bottom right corner.
4:1.

Can Yilmaz Uzun goes off the pitch and Mario
Gotze (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.

Here is a change. Leonardo Bittencourt is
going off and Horst Steffen gives the last
tactical orders to Keke Topp (Werder Bremen).

Substitution. Karim Coulibaly (Werder Bremen)
has come on for Niklas Stark.

Dino Toppmoller decides to make a substitution.
Ritsu Doan will be replaced by Nathaniel
Brown (Eintracht Frankfurt).

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Hugo Larsson as he
is replaced by Oscar Hojlund (Eintracht
Frankfurt).

Horst Steffen has decided to make a change.
Isak Hansen-Aaroen (Werder Bremen) replaces
Marco Grull.

The Freiburg players can't believe it after
the referee disallows the goal after the
intervention of the VAR!

Dimitrios Giannoulis (Augsburg) picks it
up in space and from the edge of the box
lashes in a shot that is deflected past
the helpless Noah Atubolu. 0:1.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Eren Dinkci (Freiburg) was quite harsh
and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

Christian Gunter (Freiburg) is shown a yellow
card for a late challenge.

Chrislain Matsima (Augsburg) meets the corner
and displays his eye for goal as he coolly
plants a header from close range into the
bottom right corner. The score is 0:2.

GOAL! Marius Wolf (Augsburg) receives the
ball after a swift counter attack. Still
with some work to do, he weaves his way
through the defence to score a wonderful
goal from close range to make it 0:3.

Matthias Ginter (Freiburg) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer
had an easy-decision to make.

Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Chrislain
Matsima (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.

GOAL! Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) sends the
penalty high into the top right hand corner
of the net.

Julian Schuster has decided to make a change.
Cyriaque Irie (Freiburg) replaces Eren Dinkci.

Phillip Tietz comes onto the pitch because
Dimitrios Giannoulis (Augsburg) simply cannot
continue any longer after picking up an
injury.

Mert Komur (Augsburg) has tested the patience
of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the
book for a previous late challenge.

Phillip Tietz (Augsburg) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer
had an easy-decision to make.

Substitution. Merlin Rohl (Freiburg) replaces
Yuito Suzuki.

Here is a change. Elias Saad is going off
and Sandro Wagner gives the last tactical
orders to Elvis Rexhbecaj (Augsburg).

The substitution has been made. Derry Scherhant
(Freiburg) has replaced Johan Manzambi.

Julian Schuster has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Jordy Makengo (Freiburg)
replacing Christian Gunter.

Marius Wolf (Augsburg) is given a fully
deserved yellow card.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Marius Wolf will be replaced by Cedric Zesiger
(Augsburg).

Here's the change. Robin Fellhauer leaves
the pitch and Arne Maier (Augsburg) comes
on as a substitute.

Elvis Rexhbecaj (Augsburg) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer
had an easy-decision to make.

Cyriaque Irie (Freiburg) takes his opponent
down and receives a yellow card from the
referee.

Tempers flare after a clattering challenge
by Diant Ramaj (Heidenheim), who receives
a yellow card from the referee. It could
have been worse for him!

Patrick Wimmer slides a pass towards Andreas
Skov Olsen (Wolfsburg) who unleashes a fabulous
shot from long range. The ball goes behind
the surprised goalkeeper and into the top
left corner. The score is now 0:1.

Leo Scienza (Heidenheim) takes the free
kick from a promising position. He has already
proven that he can handle such situations
and once again, he sends the ball towards
the top right corner, bouncing in off the
post.

Andreas Skov Olsen (Wolfsburg) is rightly
booked by the referee because it could not
have been anything other than a yellow card.

Moritz Jenz (Wolfsburg) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Brand
had an easy-decision to make.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) was quite
harsh and Benjamin Brand didn't hesitate
to show him a yellow card.

Substitution. Jonas Fohrenbach is replaced
by Omar Haktab Traore (Heidenheim).

Frank Schmidt is forced to make a change.
Niklas Dorsch (Heidenheim) is unable to
continue due to injury, Luca Kerber comes
on.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Lovro Majer will be replaced by Mattias
Svanberg (Wolfsburg).

Substitution. Mohamed Amoura (Wolfsburg)
receives a signal from the referee and is
now allowed to enter the pitch as Dzenan
Pejcinovic walks off.

It's a goal! Mattias Svanberg (Wolfsburg)
bursts into the box to get on the end of
a whipped in cross from Maximilian Arnold
and scores magnificently from close range
into the right side of the goal. 1:2.

Frank Schmidt has decided to make a change.
Mikkel Kaufmann Sorensen (Heidenheim) replaces
Budu Zivzivadze.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Mathias Honsak (Heidenheim)
comes onto the pitch so that Arijon Ibrahimovic
can be given a rest.

Frank Schmidt decides to make a substitution.
Tim Siersleben will be replaced by Adrian
Beck (Heidenheim).

Goal! Mohamed Amoura (Wolfsburg) wins the
battle of wills and sends an unstoppable
penalty past Diant Ramaj into right side
of the goal.

Paul Simonis has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg)
replacing Kilian Fischer.

The substitution is prepared. Vaclav Cerny
(Wolfsburg) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Andreas Skov Olsen.

Omar Haktab Traore (Heidenheim) has tested
the patience of referee Benjamin Brand and
goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

What a beauty from just outside the box!
Ilyas Ansah (Union Berlin) lashed the ball
with incredible pace and power inside the
net.

Christopher Trimmel (Union Berlin) has tested
the patience of referee Robert Hartmann
and goes into the book for a previous late
challenge.

Deniz Undav (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Robert Hartmann
had an easy-decision to make.

Ermedin Demirovic (VfB Stuttgart) has to
be very careful for the rest of the match
after receiving a yellow card from the referee
for a bad tackle on an opponent.

It's a goal! Ilyas Ansah (Union Berlin)
scores with a brilliant shot into the right
side of the goal after being released inside
the box by a superb lofted pass from Andrej
Ilic. The score is 2:0.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Janik Haberer (Union Berlin) was quite
harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate
to show him a yellow card.

The game has begun to heat up. Josha Vagnoman
(VfB Stuttgart) challenges an opponent and
receives a deserved yellow card for his
ugly tackle.

Rani Khedira (Union Berlin) is shown a yellow
card after a horrible tackle.

The game has come to an end for Ermedin
Demirovic. He has contributed as much as
he could today. He will be replaced by the
fresh legs of Tiago Tomas (VfB Stuttgart).

Steffen Baumgart decides to make a substitution.
Robert Skov will be replaced by Derrick
Kohn (Union Berlin).

It will be a substitution. Alex Kral (Union
Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Janik
Haberer walks off.

Sebastian Hoeness has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Chris Fuhrich (VfB Stuttgart)
replacing Josha Vagnoman.

That will be all from Ilyas Ansah who is
being replaced by the fresh legs of Oliver
Burke (Union Berlin).

Yellow card. Andrej Ilic (Union Berlin)
goes into the book for a bad tackle on his
opponent.

Sebastian Hoeness has decided to make a
change. Ramon Hendriks (VfB Stuttgart) replaces
Jeff Chabot.

Substitution. Atakan Karazor did his best
and is replaced by Lazar Jovanovic (VfB
Stuttgart).

Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Jamie
Leweling (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant
foul.

Today's match ends for Christopher Trimmel
who will be replaced by Josip Juranovic
(Union Berlin).

Goal! Tiago Tomas (VfB Stuttgart) scores
a Zlatan Ibrahimovic-esque back-heel goal.
What a finish that is! 2:1.

Goal! Luis Diaz (Bayern Munich) latches
on to a superb pass inside the box, finds
himself in a promising position and fires
a shot in off the inside of the right post.
The goalkeeper was helpless to keep out
his effort.

Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) has tested the
patience of referee Florian Badstubner and
goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Goal - 3:0! Serge Gnabry laid the ball off
to Michael Olise (Bayern Munich), who shot
from close range into the bottom right corner,
leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Ole Werner makes a switch. Antonio Nusa
(RB Leipzig) is coming on in place of Yan
Diomande at the start of the second period.

The game is over for Lois Openda (RB Leipzig).
Romulo Cardoso comes on for the second half.

This is a yellow card! Jonathan Tah (Bayern
Munich) is not happy with the decision,
but from our point of view it was clear.

Konrad Laimer (Bayern Munich) receives a
yellow card from the referee for a foul
that he committed a little earlier.

Harry Kane (Bayern Munich) finishes his
beautiful individual effort with a superb
strike from inside the box. Peter Gulacsi
is just a bystander as the ball flies low
into the middle of the goal. The score is
4:0.

Celebrations are cut short for RB Leipzig
as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the
VAR review shows it was offside!

The manager makes a subsitution with Aleksandar
Pavlovic (Bayern Munich) coming on for Leon
Goretzka.

Substitution. Jonathan Tah makes his way
off the pitch and Min-Jae Kim (Bayern Munich)
comes on as his replacement.

The whistle is blown for an infringement
and Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) receives
a yellow card!

Ole Werner has decided to substitute Johan
Bakayoko and he is replaced by Christoph
Baumgartner (RB Leipzig).

Here is a change. Xaver Schlager is going
off and Ole Werner gives the last tactical
orders to Ezechiel Banzuzi (RB Leipzig).

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Konrad Laimer walks off the pitch to
be replaced by Sacha Boey (Bayern Munich).

A substitution has been made. Serge Gnabry
goes off and Lennart Karl (Bayern Munich)
comes on.

Goal! Harry Kane (Bayern Munich) is teed
up on the edge of the box by Luis Diaz,
and his howitzer of a shot into the bottom
right corner gives the keeper no chance.
5:0.

GOAL! Superb work from Min-Jae Kim, who
plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares
it to Harry Kane (Bayern Munich), who beats
Peter Gulacsi with a brilliant shot into
the bottom right corner. 6:0.

Jonah Kusi Asare (Bayern Munich) joins the
action as a substitute, replacing Harry
Kane.

That's a clear yellow card. Michael Olise
(Bayern Munich) goes into the book.

Ole Werner decides to make a substitution.
Nicolas Seiwald will be replaced by Assan
Ouedraogo (RB Leipzig).
